column4: can anyone help me get my wireless working with ndiswrapper (or if you know of a different way, that would be appreciated too)?
sure we can help you but more details would be appreciated
nice, I installed the very seme just yesterday :p
i have ndiswrapper installed from Automatix for Edgy.  i'm in the dir of the file and i type in sudo ndiswrapper -i bcmwl5a.inf
yes, except for the Automatix part
it should work the way it is, please just don't use Automatix in the future
hold on, I'll give you the link to the driver I used
http://cmb.phys.cwru.edu/kisner/linux/compaq-r3000/bcmwl5a.tar.gz
have you removed the bcm43xx module so it doesn't conflicts with ndiswrapper ?
sudo modprobe -r bcm4"xx
it's normal behavior
what does ndiswrapper -l tell you now ?
are you sure you have a Broadcom ?
hmm, actually the drivers I sent you are for BMC4306, not 4309
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/39522/ the second
could you paste the lspci line regarding your wireless ? (just one line, no ned to pastebin)
http://ftp.us.dell.com/network/R76521na.EXE <= extract with cabextract
- does it matter if i just use the command "unzip" ?
which file should i use to install
the ndiswrapper Wiki says to use bcmwl5a.inf in directory AR
edit /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist
you still around to offer your world class assistance?
sorry, I have little to no experience with WPA
maybe try posting on the !forums
